This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit      on February 16, 2012 Description is in       English.                                 Descriptive Summary                                  Title:         Aubrey Wisberg Papers                       Dates:         c.1945-1970                       Abstract:                         Aubrey Wisberg, film and television writer and producer died in New York City in 1990        at the age of 78. His papers consist of typescripts for his film and television productions,        and draft copies of his novels, short stories and plays. The collection also includes        a small portion of correspondence, photos, and promotional materials relating to specific        film or television productions.                              Quantity:         16.5 linear feet (11 boxes)                        Call Phrase:         MSS 048

Adickes    1943-1945, 1970 (Bulk     1943-1945) MS 672.1                       See all finding aids in this repository Table of Contents           Descriptive Summary    Biographical Note    Scope and Content Note and Arrangement    Access Points    Administrative Information    Container List     Correspondence and Greeting Cards         Click here to request materials using your Collections Request Account                     Print / View Finding Aid as Single Page Guide to the Papers of Herbert J. Adickes     1943-1945, 1970 (Bulk      1943-1945)  MS 672.1                New-York Historical Society 170 Central Park West New York, NY 10024 Phone: (212) 873-3400  @ 2011 New-York Historical Society      Collection processed by Processed by Megan Hahn      This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit      on October 19, 2011 Description is in       English.                                 Descriptive Summary                                  Creator:                         Herbert J. Adickes                       Title:         Adickes Papers                       Dates [inclusive]:         1943-1945, 1970 (Bulk 1943-1945)                       Abstract:                         The Adickes Papers are a collection of approximately 300 letters from Herbert J. Adickes        to his girlfriend, later his wife, Virginia Miller, from January 1943 to April 1945.                              Quantity:         1.5 Linear feet                       Location note:                         Manuscript cage                        Call Phrase:         MS 672.1
